description: REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION  re:  38     MOTION   for Partial Summary Judgment . filed by   Peter Bordes, Jr.,  37     MOTION  for Summary Judgment . filed by Marc   Deveaux. For the aforementioned reasons, it is recommended that Defenda nts motion for summary judgment be GRANTED and Plaintiffs motion for summary judgment be DENIED.As to Plaintiffs claims concerning the Wage Theft comment, the Court recommends:1.GRANTING Defendants motion for summary judgment on Plaintiffs libel per  quod claim and dismissing it.2.GRANTING Defendants motion for summary judgment on Plaintiffs libel per se claim and dismissing it. Accordingly, the Court also recommends DENYING Plaintiffs motion for summary judgment on Plaintiffs libel per se claim. 3.GRANTING Defendants motion for summary judgment on Plaintiffs IIED claim and dismissing it. As to Plaintiffs claims concerning the Accounting Fraud comment, the Court recommends:1.GRANTING Defendants motion for summary judgment on Plaintiffs libel  per quod claim and dismissing it. 2.GRANTING Defendants motion for summary judgment on Plaintiffs libel per se claim. Accordingly, the Court also recommends DENYING Plaintiffs motion for summary judgment on Plaintiffs libel per se claim.3.GRANTING De fendants motion for summary judgment on Plaintiffs IIED claim and dismissing it.Lastly, as to Plaintiffs claims concerning the AI comment, the Court recommends:1.GRANTING Defendants motion for summary judgment on Plaintiffs libel per quod claim and d ismissing it. Accordingly, the Court also recommends2.GRANTING Defendants motion for summary judgment on Plaintiffs libel per se claim. Accordingly, the Court also recommends DENYING Plaintiffs motion for summary judgment on Plaintiffs libel per se c laim.3.GRANTING Defendants motion for summary judgment on Plaintiffs IIED claim and dismissing it. The Clerk of Court is respectfully requested to close Dkt. Nos. 37 and 38.SO ORDERED.  Objections to R&R due by 3/12/2025  (Signed by Magistrate Judge Jennifer E. Willis on 2/26/2025)   (jca)

description: OPINION AND ORDER re: 119 MOTION to Compel Arbitration . filed by MVI Systems LLC, Samuel Taub, 156 LETTER MOTION for Leave to File sur-reply addressed to Judge John P. Cronan from Ariel Reinitz dated Feb. 9, 2021. filed by GateGuard, Inc., 118 MOTION to Compel Arbitration pursuant to 9 U.S.C. section 3. MOTION to Dismiss pursuant to Fed. R. Civ. Pro. Rules 12(b)(1), 12(b)(6), and 9(b). filed by MVI Industries, LLC. For these reasons, the Court grants Defendants' motions to compel, stays all claims against Defendants pending arbitration, denies without prejudice Defendants' motions to dismiss as moot, and denies GateGuard's motion to file a sur-reply brief. The parties must submit quarterly joint letters informing the Court of the status of the arbitration proceeding; the first letter is due by December 20, 2021. The Clerk of the Court is respectfully directed to terminate the motions pending at Docket Numbers 118, 119, and 156. SO ORDERED. (Signed by Judge John P. Cronan on 9/28/2021) (jca) (Entered: 09/28/2021)
